subject: Rowing
lead_paragraph: Eighteen crews from the United States are set to race today at Henley Royal Regatta, one of the world’s oldest rowing events. A total of 467 rowing crews, including 114 non-British teams from 18 countries, will take part in the annual regatta — first held in 1839 — on the River Thames near London. There are 32 entries in each event, with finals Sunday.
